tags.name: radio-group
tags.description: Radio groups are used to group multiple radios or radio buttons, so they function as a single form control. Here is its [documentation](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-custom-data/blob/master/samples/webcomponents/src/components/my-component/docs.md). Use it like this: ```html My Label Option 1 Option 2 Option 3 ``` --- ### **Events:** - **custom-event** - some description for custom-event - **typed-event** - some description for typed-event - **typed-custom-event** ### **Methods:** - **validate()** - Validated the radio inputs - **checkStatus(value: _string_, message: _string_): _string_** - This is a test method with parameters ### **Slots:** - _default_ - add radio buttons to the `default` slot to create options to your radio group - **label** - placeholder for the radio group label ### **CSS Properties:** - **--radio-border-radius** - Controls the border radius of the radio buttons _(default: undefined)_ - **--radio-background-color** - Controls the color of bar _(default: red)_ ### **CSS Parts:** - **radio-label** - Applies custom styles the radio group label

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value assigned to the radio button. This will reflect in the radio group when clicked.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the radio group and all of its radio buttons

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: This will control the size of the radio buttons

attributes.name: variants
attributes.description: This is a test for internal options

attributes.name: external2
attributes.description: This is a test for external .ts options

attributes.name: external3
attributes.description: This is a test for external .ts options

attributes.name: complex
attributes.description: This is a test for options from an object

attributes.name: complex-union
attributes.description: This is a test for options from an object

tags.name: radio-button
tags.description:
Radio buttons allow users to select a single option from a group. Here is its [documentation](https://my-site.com/documentation).

Use it like this:
```html
<radio-button value="1" disabled>Your label</radio-button>
```
---


### **Slots:**
 - _default_ - add text here to label your radio button

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value assigned to the radio button. This will reflect in the radio group when clicked.

attributes.description: A mapped attribute for react wrapper example
